journeyItems.description: A late evening departure from Euston station in London, then an overnight run in the comfort of your private cabin to reach Glasgow for breakfast.

fromPlace.description: London - the UK's capital - has so many off the beaten path Byway favourites for those with time to linger. The city bursts with galleries, museums, Thames-side strolls, city parks, and amazing places to eat and drink.

toPlace.description: Scotland's largest city, Glasgow is sophisticated, earthy and impressive.

possibleActivities.title: Glasgow_tea house
possibleActivities.description: Sit outside at the tiny Tchai-Ovnal tea house, inspired by Czech Cajovna, or book a quirky brunch at the Hillhead Bookclub, for ping-pong, retro computer games, and cocktails in gramophones.
possibleActivities.longDescription: Sit outside at the tiny Tchai-Ovnal tea house, inspired by Czech Cajovna, or book a quirky brunch at the Hillhead Bookclub, for ping-pong, retro computer games, and cocktails in gramophones.

possibleActivities.title: Glasgow_art
possibleActivities.description: Wander the galleries scattered across the city - the modern art scene in Glasgow is pretty groundbreaking.
possibleActivities.longDescription: Wander the galleries scattered across the city - the modern art scene in Glasgow is pretty groundbreaking.

possibleActivities.title: Glasgow_nightlife
possibleActivities.description: Head out for a night on the town; Glasgow is home to historic pubs, fantastic micro and craft breweries and some great clubs.
possibleActivities.longDescription: Head out for a night on the town; Glasgow is home to historic pubs, fantastic micro and craft breweries and some great clubs.

possibleActivities.title: Glasgow_clubs
possibleActivities.description: Let your hair down in Glasgow’s clubs; the most famous house club in Scotland, the Sub Club, is found in the city centre (coronavirus permitting).
possibleActivities.longDescription: Let your hair down in Glasgow’s clubs; the most famous house club in Scotland, the Sub Club, is found in the city centre (coronavirus permitting).

possibleActivities.title: Glasgow_galleries
possibleActivities.description: Wander the impressive art galleries scattered across the city; the Gallery of Modern Art is particularly spectacular.
possibleActivities.longDescription: Wander the impressive art galleries scattered across the city; the Gallery of Modern Art is particularly spectacular.

place.description: Scotland's largest city, Glasgow is sophisticated, earthy and impressive.

images.tag: The view from the hotel's rooftop restaurant across central Glasgow

journeyItems.description: Join the West Highland Line heading west from Glasgow and alight at Arrochar and Tarbet to stop at Loch Lomond in the Trossachs National Park. Enjoy a wander, cycle or kayak around the Loch Lomond (we can tell you where to leave your bag), then rejoin the train and settle back to soak up incredible views along the West Highland Line onwards to the port of Oban - one of the most scenic rail routes in the world.

fromPlace.description: Scotland's largest city, Glasgow is sophisticated, earthy and impressive.

toPlace.description: A pretty west coast port town with excellent rail and ferry connections, two cathedrals and a bunch of good restaurants.

possibleActivities.title: Oban_distillery
possibleActivities.description: Take a tour of Oban's whisky distillery for an insight into the wonders of traditional whisky production.
possibleActivities.longDescription: Take a tour of Oban's whisky distillery for an insight into the wonders of traditional whisky production.

possibleActivities.title: Oban_McCaig's tower
possibleActivities.description: Walk up to McCaig's Tower, built in 1897 to provide work for local stonemasons and as a monument to the McCaig family. Enjoy the views out to sea and visit the lovely gardens within.
possibleActivities.longDescription: Walk up to McCaig's Tower, built in 1897 to provide work for local stonemasons and as a monument to the McCaig family. Enjoy the views out to sea and visit the lovely gardens within.

possibleActivities.title: Oban_seafood
possibleActivities.description: Take your time over an excellent meal; some of the UK's best seafood can be found here (Oban's been named the seafood capital of Scotland) and we'll recommend our favourite restaurants.
possibleActivities.longDescription: Take your time over an excellent meal; some of the UK's best seafood can be found here (Oban's been named the seafood capital of Scotland) and we'll recommend our favourite restaurants.

place.description: A pretty west coast port town with excellent rail and ferry connections, two cathedrals and a bunch of good restaurants.

journeyItems.description: Catch the ferry from the port of Oban towards Craignure (Mull), enjoying the sea breeze as you make your way across the water.

fromPlace.description: A pretty west coast port town with excellent rail and ferry connections, two cathedrals and a bunch of good restaurants.

toPlace.description: On the water's edge overlooking the Sound of Mull, this small town is home to the main ferry port for crossings to the mainland and the best place on the island for getting around by bus.

possibleActivities.title: Mull_island hop
possibleActivities.description: Island hop to Ulva (for woodlands, shores, moors and bird watching), Staffa (for sea caves and magnificent basalt columns) and Iona (the birthplace of Celtic Christianity).
possibleActivities.longDescription: Island hop to Ulva (for woodlands, shores, moors and bird watching), Staffa (for sea caves and magnificent basalt columns) and Iona (the birthplace of Celtic Christianity).

place.description: On the water's edge overlooking the Sound of Mull, this small town is home to the main ferry port for crossings to the mainland and the best place on the island for getting around by bus.

journeyItems.description: Join the West Coast Motors bus to travel along the beautiful coastline to Tobermory. Sit on the right hand side for the best views over the Sound of Mull (pay the driver on board).

fromPlace.description: On the water's edge overlooking the Sound of Mull, this small town is home to the main ferry port for crossings to the mainland and the best place on the island for getting around by bus.

toPlace.description: The Isle of Mull's pretty main burgh with a wide harbour lined with colourful houses. You'll find beautiful countryside, cosy pubs and fresh seafood on your doorstep.

possibleActivities.title: Mull_nature
possibleActivities.description: Marvel at stunning seascapes and wildlife galore; keep your eyes open for otters, seals, dolphins and porpoises as you explore the islands.
possibleActivities.longDescription: Marvel at stunning seascapes and wildlife galore; keep your eyes open for otters, seals, dolphins and porpoises as you explore the islands.

possibleActivities.title: Mull_Ross of Mull
possibleActivities.description: Head to the Ross of Mull for wild swimming, crag climbing and kayaking.
possibleActivities.longDescription: Head to the Ross of Mull for wild swimming, crag climbing and kayaking.

possibleActivities.title: Mull_standing stones
possibleActivities.description: Take a trip across Mull to marvel at standing stones and stone circles.
possibleActivities.longDescription: Take a trip across Mull to marvel at standing stones and stone circles.

possibleActivities.title: Mull_Iona
possibleActivities.description: Enjoy uninterrupted relaxation on the Isle of Iona, via the ferry at Fionnphort - it's a spot to allow your soul to catch up with you. Iona casts its own special magic for those who make time for the enchanting island.
possibleActivities.longDescription: Enjoy uninterrupted relaxation on the Isle of Iona, via the ferry at Fionnphort - it's a spot to allow your soul to catch up with you. Iona casts its own special magic for those who make time for the enchanting island.

possibleActivities.title: Tobermory_Mishnish
possibleActivities.description: Settle down by a roaring fire for a drink with a view at the Mishnish, Tobermory.
possibleActivities.longDescription: Settle down by a roaring fire for a drink with a view at the Mishnish, Tobermory.

possibleActivities.title: Mull_Nc'nean distillery
possibleActivities.description: Take a water taxi from Mull to Drimnin to see organic whisky startup, Nc'nea.
possibleActivities.longDescription: Take a water taxi from Mull to Drimnin to see organic whisky startup, Nc'nea.

place.description: The Isle of Mull's pretty main burgh with a wide harbour lined with colourful houses. You'll find beautiful countryside, cosy pubs and fresh seafood on your doorstep.

journeyItems.description: Perhaps too early a start for some travellers (let us know if you want an alternative!), but those who opt for this route are rewarded by some spectacular scenery. Take the first boat of the day from Tobermory to Kilchoan, where bus 506 waits for the onward journey to Fort William. It’s rated as one of Scotland’s finest bus routes, skirting the shores of Loch Sunart and Loch Linnhe (both services are 'turn up and go', so have your fare ready). From Fort William, take the bus across the water to Portree on the Isle of Skye.

fromPlace.description: The Isle of Mull's pretty main burgh with a wide harbour lined with colourful houses. You'll find beautiful countryside, cosy pubs and fresh seafood on your doorstep.

toPlace.description: A pretty town in the centre of Skye sitting below the Cullins mountains, with some of Scotland's best restaurants and cosiest pubs, and wild walks through dramatic landscapes on the doorstep.

possibleActivities.title: Skye_general
possibleActivities.description: Stroll Skye's diverse beaches, watching out for eagles overhead, and bundling up for nighttime stargazing under these rare skies free of light pollution.
possibleActivities.longDescription: Stroll Skye's diverse beaches, watching out for eagles overhead, and bundling up for nighttime stargazing under these rare skies free of light pollution.

possibleActivities.title: Skye_Eilean Donan
possibleActivities.description: Travel back in time at beautifully situated 13th Century Eilean Donan Castle, across the water from Skye close to Kyle of Lochalsh, at Dornie. Buses 915, 916 or 917 direct from Portree on Skye take about 80 minutes.
possibleActivities.longDescription: Travel back in time at beautifully situated 13th Century Eilean Donan Castle, across the water from Skye close to Kyle of Lochalsh, at Dornie. Buses 915, 916 or 917 direct from Portree on Skye take about 80 minutes.

possibleActivities.title: Skye_walking
possibleActivities.description: Climb one of Skye's Munros for spectacular views over the island. They're challenging hikes, and some require some technical climbing, so mountaineering experience is essential for most. Bruach na Frithe is a good choice if you don't have much experience.
possibleActivities.longDescription: Climb one of Skye's Munros for spectacular views over the island. They're challenging hikes, and some require some technical climbing, so mountaineering experience is essential for most. Bruach na Frithe is a good choice if you don't have much experience.

possibleActivities.title: Skye_whisky
possibleActivities.description: Visit one of the island's whisky distilleries to find out what makes the whisky from Skye so special.
possibleActivities.longDescription: Visit one of the island's whisky distilleries to find out what makes the whisky from Skye so special.

possibleActivities.title: Skye_adventure
possibleActivities.description: Scramble your way through the island's rivers and canyons on a day's gorge walking. Climb up rock faces, jump into deep plunge pools and slide down waterfalls.
possibleActivities.longDescription: Scramble your way through the island's rivers and canyons on a day's gorge walking. Climb up rock faces, jump into deep plunge pools and slide down waterfalls.

place.description: A pretty town in the centre of Skye sitting below the Cullins mountains, with some of Scotland's best restaurants and cosiest pubs, and wild walks through dramatic landscapes on the doorstep.

journeyItems.description: From Portree, leave the Isle of Skye by taking the bus down to Armadale (pay the driver for your fare) where you'll board the ferry to Mallaig. Back on the mainland, take the West Highland Line train from Mallaig to Fort William, over the famous Glenfinnan viaduct - the route to Hogwarts!

fromPlace.description: A pretty town in the centre of Skye sitting below the Cullins mountains, with some of Scotland's best restaurants and cosiest pubs, and wild walks through dramatic landscapes on the doorstep.

toPlace.description: The outdoor capital of Scotland, sitting on the shores of Loch Linnhe, overlooked by Ben Nevis.

journeyItems.description: The journey starts with an evening crossing of Rannoch Moor. If it’s still light, enjoy a feast of fine scenery then snooze your way south in a comfortable private sleeping cabin to reach London in time for breakfast.

fromPlace.description: The outdoor capital of Scotland, sitting on the shores of Loch Linnhe, overlooked by Ben Nevis.

toPlace.description: London - the UK's capital - has so many off the beaten path Byway favourites for those with time to linger. The city bursts with galleries, museums, Thames-side strolls, city parks, and amazing places to eat and drink.
